column2: NY DRIVERS LICENSE TEST
column4: New York
column6: NY

column2: Question Text
column4: Answer1 Text
column6: Answer2 Text
column8: Answer3 Text

column2: 1. If you must drive during ice or snow storms, you should:
column4: clear the ice and snow from your vehicle.
column6: make sure the windshield washer reservoir is filled with a cleaning solution that resists freezing.
column8: drive slowly.

column2: 2. What does a flashing yellow light mean?
column4: Drivers may move forward with caution.
column6: The same thing as a stop sign.
column8: Warning: hospital ahead.

column2: 3. On average, how long does it take your body to remove the alcohol contained in 5 ounces of wine?
column4: 10 minutes.
column6: one hour.
column8: 3 hours.

column2: 4. The sample route signs, left to right, are for:
column4: interstate, state, and U.S. routes.
column6: state, U.S., and interstate routes.
column8: state, interstate and U.S. routes.

column2: 5. This sign warns that:
column4: the pavement ends.
column6: traffic must merge right.
column8: traffic must merge left.
column10: the bridge ahead is wide enough for only one vehicle at a time.

column2: 6. What should you do if a vehicle is approaching head-on in your lane?
column4: Come to a complete stop and use your horn to warn the vehicles behind you.
column6: Decrease speed, pull over to the right and sound your horn to warn the other driver.
column8: Turn off the ignition if your vehicle has power steering.
column10: Pull over to the left and use your emergency lights to stop the other driver.

column2: 7. Where must a pedestrian walk when there are no sidewalks?
column4: On the side of the road, facing the traffic.
column6: On the side of the road, in the same direction of traffic.
column8: In the middle of the road, facing oncoming traffic.
column10: On the left side of the road, behind slower vehicles.

column2: 8. You should never depend on your mirrors when you prepare to change lanes. Why?
column4: You should look over your shoulder instead.
column6: Mirrors leave “blind spots” behind both sides of vehicles.
column8: Mirrors are useless.

column2: 9. To reduce their chances of colliding with an animal, drivers should:
column4: look well down the road and far off to each side.
column6: Slow down when approaching animals that are standing near the road.
column8: scan the sides of the road to watch for the reflection of vehicle headlights in the eyes of animals.

column2: 10. You hear a siren close by but can not see where the emergency vehicle is. What do you do?
column4: Stop only if you are sure that the vehicle is headed toward you in the opposite lane.
column6: Stop immediately and activate your emergency flashers.
column8: Pull over to the right side of the road and stop until you are sure the emergency vehicle is not headed toward you.
column10: Keep driving until you are sure the emergency vehicle is headed toward you.

column2: 11. What should you do if your vision through the windshield becomes blocked?
column4: Pull your vehicle off the road and park it.
column6: Open the side window so you can see.
column8: Turn on your emergency lights.

column2: 12. What should you do in case of a steering failure?
column4: Call an ambulance.
column6: Leave the road immediately.
column8: Pump your gas pedal a few times to increase the pressure.
column10: Don't panic. Turn on your emergency lights to let other drivers know you are having car problems. Move toward the side of the road and bring the car to a gradual stop.

column2: 13. In New York City, unless a sign that permits it is posted:
column4: you must not yield the right-of-way to oncoming traffic and pedestrians.
column6: you are not allowed to stop at a red light.
column8: you are not allowed to turn on a red light.
column10: you must not make a right turn at a steady green light.

column2: 14. Seat belt use is not required in ____ or older vehicles.
15. If you are blinded by headlights on an approaching vehicle, you should:
column4: move your eyes to the right.
column6: flash your headlights to high beam for a second, then return to low beam.
column8: use the road edge as a guide until the approaching vehicle passes by.

column2: 16. If you hear an emergency vehicle heading toward your vehicle, in which case are you required to pull over and stop?
column4: When the emergency vehicle is coming from the right.
column6: When the emergency vehicle is coming from the left.
column8: When the emergency vehicle is headed toward you in the opposite lane of a two-lane roadway.

column2: 17. Roads are most slippery:
column4: just before it rains.
column6: on hills.
column8: when it stops raining.
column10: when it first starts to rain.

column2: 18. BAC is:
column4: the percentage of alcohol in your blood.
column6: the number of ounces of alcohol in your blood.
column8: the amount of alcohol in your body.

column2: 19. This sign means:
column4: Right turns not allowed.
column6: Warning: U-turn ahead.
column8: Hairpin corner ahead.

column2: 20. Courts must order all drivers convicted of DWI or AGG-DWI to:
column4: install and maintain an ignition interlock on any vehicle owned or operated by such driver.
column6: attend a Safe Driving Course.
column8: attend an approved driver education course.
column10: drink no alcohol at all for 6 months.
